## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I'm trying to initiate a currency launch, but I'm not sure why I need to fund my wallet with a certain amount of VRSCTEST. Can you explain why you need to fund your wallet with 1000 VRSCTEST before sending the transaction to initiate a currency launch?

**AI Assistant:**
Actually, you need to fund your wallet with at least 10 VRSCTEST before sending the transaction to initiate a currency launch, not 1000 VRSCTEST. Additionally, the currency launch will start at 50 blocks from when the transaction was made (default), and it must have 1000 VRSCTEST preconverted at 0.01 VRSCTEST per GOLD in order to launch. Do you have any other questions about initiating a currency launch?

**User:**
Thanks for the clarification! I have another question. How do you create new tokens after a currency has launched, using a decentralized issuance option?

**AI Assistant:**
Actually, after a currency has launched, the only way to create new tokens is with a centralized issuance option, not a decentralized one. I hope that helps clarify things for you! Do you have any other questions about creating new tokens or currency management?

**User:**
I have one more question. What happens if you send the command to convert VRSCTEST to GOLD before the GOLD token launches?

**AI Assistant:**
If you send the command to convert VRSCTEST to GOLD before the GOLD token launches, your conversion will be effectively parked until the token launches. At that point, you will either find 0.975 GOLD in your wallet, or you will have your VRSCTEST back. Does that make sense? Do you have any other questions about converting VRSCTEST to GOLD or token management?
Can you explain why you need to fund your wallet with 1000 VRSCTEST before sending the transaction to initiate a currency launch?

Actually, you need to fund your wallet with at least 10 VRSCTEST before sending the transaction to initiate a currency launch, not 1000 VRSCTEST. Additionally, the currency launch will start at 50 blocks from when the transaction was made (default), and it must have 1000 VRSCTEST preconverted at 0.01 VRSCTEST per GOLD in order to launch.

ncy must be funded with at least 10 VRSCTEST before sending the transaction returned from this command to
initiate a currency launch that will start at 50 blocks from when it was made (default), and that must have 1000 VRSCTEST preconverted at 0.01 VRSCTEST per GOLD in order to launch.
all of this happens as part of the mining process, since mining the blocks that launch a currency earn the 0.025% conversion fees of participation
in the launch, converting VRSCTEST to GOLD. I could send the following command before the block where GOLD token launches.
After it launches, the only way at present to create new tokens is with a centralized issuance option. To convert VRSCTEST to GOLD, you could issue the command:
```
./verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "*" '[{"address":"mike@","convertto":"gold","preconvert":1,"amount":100}]'
```
that would effectively park my conversion until the token launches, at which point, I will either find 0.975 GOLD in my wallet, or I will have my VRSCTEST back.
Assuming it launches, and I later want to create mycoin, which can be converted to with either GOLD or VRSCTEST, I can create mycoin with:
